SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

NO. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A. Aged of settlement in the region

It is difficult to secure a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual will be asked about every aspect of the new experiences as such. Some of the questions will apply to your experience; others may prove interesting to you even though they do not apply to your experience.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experiences of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires:

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Life: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Face?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

1. Pioneer health conditions
2. Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
3. Pioneer housing
4. Pioneer education and churchwork
5. Pioneer farming experiences

Preservation of Questionnaires:

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.

[Stamp]
PIONEER EXPERIENCE: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

It is difficult to express a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions may not apply to your experience; others may apply in part or in whole.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experiences of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or reply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Western Pioneers: What Did Western Canada Mean to You?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ).
